column4: i'm trying to use ssh screens, but when i press ctrl+a in the terminal, nothing happens
and buttons840: ctrl-a plus another key is required, I think
it should bring up the screen channel list
ctrl-a-c creates a new screen window, ctrl-a-d detaches a window, ...
it wont register in the terminal
ctrl-a does nothing ... you've go tto hit another key :)
so i should use something besides ctrl?  so try <some unknown button>+a?
sorry, I mean the keyboard combo ctrl-a is not supposed to do anything in screen. It's the start of a combination, like ctrl-a-" or ctrl-a-c
bit busy at the moment. Another option is to disable keyboard shortcuts in your terminal. are you using gnome terminal ?
edit -> keyboard shortcuts, and disable all of them
